intro: Neurocarpum densiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered neurocarpum, is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes vines and climbers. It is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical fruits that are typically covered in a rough, fibrous outer layer. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
